title: Parents may not let you miss class, but Hillary Clinton will. 'Please excuse Grace'
text:
CLOSE

Former U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton wrote a student a note for missing class to be on "The View." (Photo: Win McNamee, Getty Images)

A student was ready to risk it all to see Hillary Clinton live and in person.

A young woman was in the audience during the former presidential candidate's appearance on "The View" and expressed that she was missing class to be there.

Clinton decided to write her teacher a note excusing her absence.

"Please excuse Grace from missing class, she was at 'The View' with me," the former First Lady wrote on a blue note card and signed it.

"The View" tweeted out a photo Thursday morning showing Grace smiling and holding the note alongside three of her friends.

Nothing like getting a note to excuse you from class from @HillaryClinton!

➖

“Please excuse Grace for missing class. She was at ‘The View’ with me- Hillary Rodham Clinton” pic.twitter.com/S3sB7URrNF — The View (@TheView) October 3, 2019

"Nothing like getting a note to excuse you from class from @HillaryClinton!" the tweet read.

Opal Vadhan, one of Clinton's people, also tweeted out a photo of Clinton taking time to sign the note during a commercial break.

During commercial break at @TheView Grace was in the audience and said she’s missing class to be there. SO, @HillaryClinton wrote her a note to excuse her from class.



“Please excuse Grace from missing class, she was at #TheView with me.” #GutsyWomenpic.twitter.com/Daa2GXYKP3 — Opal Vadhan (@OpalVadhan) October 2, 2019

Clinton appeared on "The View" on Wednesday with her daughter, Chelsea Clinton, to talk about Donald Trump's impeachment inquiry and their new book, "The Book of Gutsy Women."

The duo also visited "Good Morning America" on Tuesday to promote the book where Former Secretary of State Clinton said that the “gutsiest” personal thing she's ever done was "stay in my marriage."

Clinton added that publicly and politically, her presidential run took the most courage. "And keep going. Just get up every day and keep going.”

We're not sure if Grace's gutsy move will be approved by her teacher, but at least she got a pretty cool souvenir out of it.

Contributing Savannah Behrmann​​​​​
